page.title: 11CHANGE IN ALTON
page.content: Alton was once a quiet little village. If a stranger walked into Alton now at about 9:30am or 6:00pm,he would see a High Street full of coaches,buses and cars and the only sounds he would hear are constant purr of engines and the frequent peep of horns.But if he walked into Alton at 2:00pm he would see a totally different High Street,free of the bustle of traffic travelling to Alton Towers. Alton has changed in other ways.New private housing estates and a Village Hall have been added to the old part of the village,with its Â£Lock-up' or Round House,built in the 19th Century as a makeshift prison,and other interesting old buildings. Many of the pubs do "Bed and Breakfast" as do other places such as the Malthouse, Dale Farm and Â£Holiday Homes in Alverton'.
